subject: Art & Design
title: Gestalt Principles: How the Brain Groups Shapes
description: A quick, practical guide to Gestalt Principles: How the Brain Groups Shapes.

hook.text: You see a triangle in three Pac-Man shapes. There's no triangle there â€” your brain invented it.

buildup.text: Gestalt psychology says the brain organizes visual input into meaningful wholes, not individual parts.

discovery.text: Key principles: proximity (close = grouped), similarity (alike = related), closure (brain fills gaps).

twist.text: Designers use Gestalt deliberately. Group related buttons close together. Users will assume they're connected.

climax.text: The Olympics logo, FedEx arrow, and NBC peacock all exploit Gestalt principles to create meaning from shapes.

punchline.text: Design doesn't create meaning. Your brain does. Design just sets the stage.

quiz.question: What do Gestalt principles explain?
options: How the brain organizes visual input into meaningful wholes
